alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 18 at 11:05PM PDT until May 19 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet with max sets to 8 feet due to elevated surf. The highest surf is expected along south facing beaches of Los Angeles County. Minor tidal overflow will also be possible around the time of high tide Friday evening. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Ventura County Beaches, Malibu Coast, and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides will happen around 9 to 930 PM Friday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches
